name: Marinated Squid
keywords: appetizer, cilantro, ginger, green pepper, iceberg lettuce, lemon juice, lemongrass, lime juice, red bell pepper, seafood, squid, low calorie, low-fat
recipeIngredient: 6 stalks fresh lemon grass, minced or 1/2 cup dried
1 pound small squid, cleaned and cut into 1/4-inch-thick circles, tentacles reserved
1 red bell pepper, seeded, deveined and cut into thin slivers
1 green bell pepper, seeded, deveined and cut into thin slivers

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the lemon grass, chili flakes, lemon and lime juices, ginger and 1 teaspoon of the olive oil in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Pour half of this vinaigrette into a small bowl. Refrigerate. Blanch the squid in boiling salt water for 1 minute. Drain. Rinse under cold running water until chilled and add to the vinaigrette. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

Drain the squid. Set aside. Pour the reserved vinaigrette into a large glass or ceramic bowl. Whisk in the remaining olive oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add the squid, peppers, scallions and coriander. Toss to combine. Divide the lettuce between 4 plates. Top with the salad and serve immediately.
